hints.content:
First, let's find the area and perimeter of the striped rectangle.  


[[☃ image 1]]

We can find area of a rectangle by multiplying its length by its width.  
Area $= \greenD{2} \times \greenD{8} \!=\!\! \greenD{16} \text{ sq cm}$ 

We find perimeter by adding the lengths of the sides.  
Perimeter $= \greenD2 + \greenD2 + \greenD{8} + \greenD{8} = \greenD{20} \text{ cm}$

options.alt: A tall rectangle. Along its left side, the rectangle is labeled 8 centimeters. Along the top, it is labeled 2 centimeters. !

hints.content:
Next, we find the area and perimeter of the other rectangle. 

$$ | Area | Perimeter
:- | :- | :-
![A tall rectangle. Along its left side, the rectangle is labeled 8 centimeters. Along the top, it is labeled 2 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/40466536a093b30321192772d3899bb0cb226b5f) | $\greenD{2} \times \greenD8 = \greenD{16} \text{ sq cm}$    | $\greenD{2} + \greenD{2} + \greenD8 + \greenD8 = \greenD{20} \text{ cm}$
![A wide rectangle. Along its left side, the rectangle is labeled 2 centimeters. Along the top, it is labeled 8 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c02d84ccda34a1bc9dc4809099ef480bc796116d)   | $\blueD8 \times \blueD{2} = \blueD{16} \text{ sq cm}$   | $\blueD8 + \blueD8+ \blueD{2} + \blueD{2} = \blueD{20} \text{ cm}$

Now, lets compare the area and perimeters of the rectangles.

Area:  
$\greenD{16}\text { sq cm}=\blueD{16}\text{ sq cm}$

Perimeter:  
$\greenD{20}\text { cm}=\blueD{20}\text{ cm}$
The rectangles have the same area and perimeter.
